articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday that the Russian army is making a pretence of an Easter ceasefire declared by President Vladimir Putin, continuing overnight attempts to inflict front-line losses on Ukraine.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says Russian army 'trying to create impression' of Easter ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Orthodox faith is central to Putin's world view and he attends services during major church holidays.
articles.title: Putin attends Orthodox Easter service after declaring  ceasefire in Ukraine

articles.author: Andrew Chung, Luc Cohen, Kristina Cooke, Jack Queen
articles.description: The case raises questions about the Trump administration's adherence to limits set by the Supreme Court. It carries the risk of a significant clash between the two coequal branches of government and potentially a full-blown constitutional crisis.
articles.title: US Supreme Court temporarily blocks deportations of Venezuelan migrants under wartime law

articles.author: Erin Banco
articles.description: Israel has not ruled out an attack on Iran's nuclear facilities in the coming months despite President Donald Trump telling Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the U.S. was for now unwilling to support such a move, according to an Israeli official and two other people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: Israel still eyeing a limited attack on Iran's nuclear facilities

articles.author: Rachael Levy
articles.description: The father of a U.S.-Israeli hostage held in Gaza said on Saturday he remains hopeful his 21-year-old son was still alive after Hamas said it could not account for his status.
articles.title: Father of American hostage in Gaza hopeful he is still alive
Iran, US to hold talks in Rome in bid to reach nuclear deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Soyuz MS-26 spacecraft carrying Russian cosmonauts Alexey Ovchinin and Ivan Wagner and NASA astronaut Donald Pettit has returned to Earth, Russia's Roscosmos space agency reported on Sunday.
articles.title: Spacecraft brings Russians, American back to earth, Russia's space agency says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sitting in a crowd of mothers and children under the harsh sun, Najlaa Ahmed described the moment the Rapid Support Forces men poured into Darfur's Zamzam displacement camp, looting and burning homes as shells rained down and drones flew overhead.
articles.title: Survivors describe executions, arson in attack on Sudan's Zamzam camp

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Gunmen killed 56 people in central Nigeria, AFP reported on Saturday, citing the governor's office.
articles.title: 56 killed in Nigeria shooting, AFP reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Britain has urged Russia to commit to a full ceasefire in Ukraine, "not just a one-day pause", its foreign ministry said in a statement on Saturday.
articles.title: Britain urges Russia to commit to full ceasefire in Ukraine
